summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Linden Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from North Forty-second Street to North Fiftieth Street, by constructing concrete sidewalks, with wooden crosswalks, in accordance with Resolution of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
